column4: anyone know why I would get an out of memory error when trying to mount shares on one of my winboxes but not the other?
what size, in human, is your swap file?
copy the swap line in /etc/fstab for us
if u can help it, try not to use uid,
that'll just confuse the heck out of you
not sure yet...rebooting the winbox...had an idea
it may be a problem with the way the win shares are configured
i did that earlier but i still have mem errors with the win shares
so after that whole thing, it wasn't ram, but smb shares?
